segments.text: he was ready to swear he heard her speaking to him.
You must wake up, Dan, I miss you so much.
In his heart, he wondered why he couldn't break free from dreams of her.
Night after night, she visited them, entire conversations he held with her within them.
There are guests in her small cabin, and he always watched from the side, seeing the back of a sweet curly-haired baby.
Occasionally, fears rose in him that she had found someone else and already had a baby.
But a moment later, he pushed them aside, convincing himself it was impossible.
After all, he hears her in his dreams, and yet this baby, he seems so alive to him.
Curly-haired and wise, a line from Rachel the poet's song rose in him.
And now, as is like an echo, he heard her pleading.
I want to see that warm brown in your eyes, please, Dan.
He shifted restlessly.
His eyelids fluttered against the morning light filtering through the shutters.
His eyes opened for a moment to slits, then closed again.
He felt the warmth of a small body pressed against his and reached out to it.
Only then did he open his eyes again and looked in amazement at the curly-haired baby from his dreams sleeping beside him.
And a minute later, he saw the beautiful face of his girl from the pink house.
Dull daylight entered the room.
He glanced around, still convinced he was dreaming, seeing the treatment cart on the side, noticing the metal bed they all lay upon.
Intermittently closing and opening his eyes, he reached out and excitedly stroked the black curls beside him.
I know you from the dreams, child.
I could never see your face, and now I see how sweet you are.
And these curls, I had ones just like them when I was little.
I saw you toddling in small steps next to her feet in the magical garden surrounding her pink house.
I missed you so much, afraid she'd forgotten me.
Maybe given up and found someone else, he spoke to his heart.
For a moment, his gaze rested on her, her hand protectively wrapping the small body of her son, lying across his chest, connecting them all into one bundle.
He held his breath, afraid to move, afraid the dream would vanish.
His eyes unable to detach from her sleeping face, partly covered by her long hair.
And that intoxicating scent of her freshly washed hair, or maybe it was the baby's curls he sensed, his eyes adjusted to the sleeping room.
and then returned to the head beside him.

He was focused on her, unable to tear his eyes from her face, stunned by the realization gradually dawning on him that this wasn't a dream, and suddenly found himself staring deep into her blue eyes opening into his.
He plunged deep into her eyes, not moving, afraid the moment would disappear, and only then noticed the tears streaming from her eyes.
felt her hand wrapping his hand rising slowly, wiping the tears that flowed on their own from his eyes, and heard her whisper to him hoarsely, welcome Daddy Dan, my name is Ben.
